Within the second week, I started on Lunesta...well my doc must have anticipated this possible side effect and had prescribed Lunesta in conjuction with the Wellbutrin..just in case....umm...now I can't seen to not take the sleeping pill..when I have tried to go without, it's pure misery..wierd dreams, nightmares, oh so tired..until I take my mornng dosage of Wellbutrin..and then the cycle starts all over again...take the Lunesta, don't take the Lunesta..longest I've gone is 2-3 days and then I just can't take the lack of sleep! My doc said I should only take the Lunesta when I really feel I need it..hello!! I need it every night...the withdrawal effect is unbearable...2 to 3 days is the longest I've gone in not taking...also extreme inner ringing in my ears..sounds like I'm in a house full of crickets!! column2: Darth42, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I've been on Bupropion (generic of Wellbutrin) for 5 weeks now. I started at 75mg 2x/day, and am currently at 100mg 2x/day.  My depression symptoms have subsided and I am more comfortable around people with less irritability.  However, I continue to have anxiety and constant worry (Generalized Anxiety Disorder).  It appears that Wellbutrin does not list this as one of the treatable conditions.  I am considering switching to Prozac instead.  One major plus about Wellbutrin is that it has had no sexual side effects on me, unlike other antidepressants I've tried before such as Paxil and Lexapro.  Also, I haven't had any weight gain from taking Wellbutrin; however, my appetite has increased (I get hungry quicker).  If depression is the only condition to be treated, then I would recommend Wellbutrin.

column2: tat2moon, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I'm 27, female, with a long history of severe depression. I've been taking generic Wellbutrin 75mg for less than a week now, and so far it seems to be helping. I'm sometimes groggy in the morning, but it goes away and I feel awake and clear-headed all day. One unusual thing: by evening I sometimes feel anxious, and two nights ago I had a full-blown panic attack and could not stop crying and feeling scared. I had a very stressful day at work though so maybe I can attribute the panic to that. I also notice changes in my appetite, like I will be hungry but not want food, or feel full after three bites of something. My energy level seems better, and I don't feel a lack of sexual desire like I did before the drug. The flat, gray feeling seems to be lessening. Overall, I do feel better, like a fog has been lifted off of me.In two weeks I'll switch to the brand-name version at 150mg, so hopefully things keep improving. Hope this helps!

column2: deannad, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: In the fifth grade I was diagnosed with ADHD. I was originally prescribed Ritalin but can not take stimulants due to a weird reaction and I developed Tourettes Syndrome.  After years of trial and error with medications I have settled with Strattera 60mg and Wellbutrin XL 150 mg.  They work well together. The Wellbutrin helps with ADHD, depression, and helps balance the irritability I get from strattera, however it does make me more anxious, which is hard to live with.  The Strattera lets me concentrate and my grades are decent in my third year college. With any drug there are side affects but after six years the Wellbutrin is still working. It doesn't seem as harsh as other drugs and the weight management is just a bonus.  If I forget to take it my day is not so smooth.

column2: crushsteffy, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Well, I've only been on the meds for a little over 2 weeks, but I have noticed a definite improvement! I am still irritable, and that's something I wish would get better, but I'm glad not to be so miserable and "blah" everyday... I figure, at least I'm not an emotional wreck and I can at least tolerate some of the things that were making me feel terrible before.  Also, I have definitely experienced decrease in appetite... I don't eat much during the day, but sometimes at night I'll wake up and find myself going to the fridge to make myself a sandwich because I'm so hungry from not eating all day!  Also, I find it more difficult to fall asleep, and normally I go to bed pretty early and have no issues, so it's weird for me.  Other than the appetite and insomnia this med seems ok.  I might consider doubling up to see if it will help my irritability, but I will give it another week.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years
column9: Where do I begin? Wellbutrin, I thought was a lifesaver until I begin to slow down and do "normal" things in my life. I literally felt like a zombie once re-prescribed this medication (I did not take the medication while pregnant). Times where it was perfectly normal for me to cry (like a funeral) I would not cry at all. I was desensitized to the world around me to include my newborn. I immediately took myself off the medication without the guidance of the doctor (bad idea - but at the time it worked for me). I did not have any withdrawal issues, which is a good thing! Nevertheless, I begin to try other medications in hopes of addressing my depression. But, I did not want to go through life feeling numb. In the end, I have turned to herbal treatment which is working wonders for me. I will NOT go back to this medication. I promised myself and those who love me.

column2: Dee, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: My depression was triggered by my brothers suicide & moms cancer diagnosis(both within 2007.) I have been trying to find somthing to just get me through this time so I can be sane for my family- not to pretend it is not there. I am on my second month on Welbutrin. It took at least a month to kick in. I was irritated easily for the first few weeks, but that went away a few weeks ago. I have lost just a few pounds and I do not feel like a flat line like I did on Lexapro. My sex drive is also still intact, thank God! The only downfall is that every night I get nausea, wich is why for me, it is not easy to use. My doc says to wait it out a few more weeks and make sure to take it every MORNING (I work nights so I took it later) I tried to have two drinks one night, and almost vomitted. I also got airsick for the first time. But I laugh again, and I am ready to be there for my mom now, who will be undergoing a stem-cell transplant soon. The stress is not gone- but I can at least handle it better now.My husband and mom both need me too much for me to wallow in misery all the time. If only I could get rid of the damn nausea! Oh yea, my husband said he noticed my memory has been better. I used to think depression was somthing you could talk yourself out of. Somtimes you have nothing left to give, and that is when it is time to see a doc or counseling to search what is right for you. I hope this helped someone because alot of the others helped me. Good luck!

column2: das, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
Sarasotagirl, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I have been bi-polar most of my life but was only diagnosed about 5 years ago. My doctor prescribed Wellbutrin XL Paxil and Geodon. It worked wonders. I could sit and finish the things I started. I didn't have the terrible ups and downs. Everything went well until my insurance company switched me to the generic when it came out. After a month on the generic I was going on shopping sprees and spending money I didn't have and had an anxiety attacks for the first time in years. When it got worse in the second month I went to the doctor and got her to write a new script for NAME BRAND Wellbutrin XL - had to pay more money for it but after just 2 weeks things were much better. Later found out that millions of poeple had bad reactions to the generic - some even committed suicide. If you were prescribed the generic get your doctor to write a medically nessacary script and try the name brand.

column2: hopeful, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)

column2: Sinclair, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I have suffered from anxiety attacks and severe migraines since I was a child. I realized I needed to be treated for depression when I was in my early 30's. I finally went to a doctor and asked for help. After trying some different medications and dosages we finally decided on Wellbutrin XL 450mg with Effexor XR 225mg. I've been on this for about 2 years. IT WAS THE BEST THING I EVER DID! My anxiety and anger was gone after a few weeks. I stopped fighting with my husband and co-workers everyday. I was able to take difficult situations in stride. The worst side effect was dry mouth. I will say that after reading some of these reviews I'm terrified to ever go off of the Effexor XR.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)

It also takes away the libido. Yeah...that sucks. So my doc switched me to Wellbutrin 100mg, and at first, just like a post I read earlier. I felt drugged, tired and wierd. I kept taking it though. It's been about a month, and I love it. It's false happiness in a pill, but I guess that is better than none at all right? I love it !!! I am not as anti-social as I had become. Starting to be myself again, which I thought would never happen.

column2: (Patient)
column9: The first time I took this drug I took it for almost a year and had no problems with it, other than some diahrrea. I recently resumed taking it again after being off of it for almost 6 months due to problems with my insurance. For the past two days I have suffered with horrible anxiety attacks, I had to go to the emergency room yesterday. I have never had anxiety attacks or anxiety problems before. I think I would rather be depressed than experience anything like that ever again. I felt like I was on acid or losing my mind or something. In addition to the new anxiety, it has also caused me to be continuously either constipated or have diahrrea, nothing in between. It also gave me insomnia, which by itself is  manageable but coupled with anxiety it can drive a person insane. I will not take this drug again, even if it means crying out my depressions and talking myself out of suicide. Be careful and be prepared.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have been on this drug for about 2 months.  And I love it.  I started falling into depression after my first pregnancy, everyone told me it would go away but it didn't.  Than after losing my second pregnancy at 20 weeks (twins), I couldn't handle it.  After being depressed and not recognizing myself for about a year and a half I decided to do something about it.  My doctor put me on 300 mg of the XL.  And I had some of the side effects like not sleeping, dry mouth, lower libedo.  But the whole libedo and sleeping thing now have subsided and with the whole dry mouth I just drink a lot of water.  Which isn't a bad thing.  I love this drug, I have more energy during the day, I am back to my old happy self.  And my husband is happy because I am back to the person he married and not some Psyco women that he never knows what mood she is going to be in or what will set her off next.

column2: 13-18 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: basically i hardly know what i was like without medication. i am 17 and have recently switched to wellbutrin from lexapro, i am not satisfied, at first i had more energy and other that withdrawal from lexapro i felt better, but now i am constantly lightheaded and dizzy, my vision constantly blurs and i am tiered but can never fall asleep, i had horrible insomnia from childhood off and on again even with meletonin (a natural over the counter sleep aid) so i am cautious of continuing with my medication. i recommend trying this drug, but it is probably best if you are an adult.  also for those teenagers out there who are considering medication i would proceed cautiously, it is a slippery slope, addiction is possible and dependence probable. good luck- nickey

column2: R113, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: From what research I've done I think this might work well for people that are very depressed. However I was taking 150mg of the XL. Within 30 days I was ANGRY and mood swings did not begin to explain it. I switched from 30mg of Cymbalta, being used as a mood swing adjuster. Wellbutrin XL made my life hell for my close friends and family as well as myself. I went off over how beds should be made, to what color shirts were. I'm still dealing with the aftermath of stopping all mood adjustment drugs now. This made me loose myself and control of my actions. Something I never want a drug to do for me. Good luck and please be aware of your actions when your on it.

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I was on this medication for the last two years of high school and 1st year of college. My doctor switched me to wellbutrin sr (which didnt work as well for me) but the time i was on wellbutrin xl, it changed my life! Grades improved, I was getting honors (something I had never gotten before) and I was very very driven and motivated to do things. It helped my concentration so much and my desire to accomplish things in my life. I will give this warning: once being on it for long periods of time I felt great and felt like I didnt need meds anymore. I would stop taking it and within a month later would have horrible episodes from being off of it. This happened to me about three times. Once your on it, it is hard to get off but it definately improved my life. I am now on an SSRI and have found that I have no emotion at all and its hard to feel anything. While on wellbutrin, I still could feel emotions,etc. It didnt take every feeling away from me totally. This is a good drug to take, especially for a teenager, that is when I started it. I attribute all my accomplishments to this drug, I realy would not be where i am today without it and I am looking in to going back on it in combination with my SSRI

column1: Depressed Mood Disorder Occurring Every Year at the Same Time
column2: katzndolz@hotmail.com, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: living a somewhat normal everyday life....unnoticed as to depression

column2: SunnyRays, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: If there is anyone who knows this drug it's me. I've been on it since it was created. If you want further info you can email me b/c it won't all fit here: roberts.rachela@yahoo.com. This drug works for depression & smoking cessation-no doubt. However, don't expect to be able to stop taking it, in my case, perhaps ever. 5 x's I've stopped. The 1st 3 were due to no insurance & by the 3rd I was 'rationing' pills and splitting them in half. The 4th was an attempt to ween myself and the 5th was w/a Dr.'s assistance that Rx'd another drug to ease me off. I CANNOT BE WITHOUT THIS DRUG. It's a horrendous 'rubber band effect' I call the "crash n burn". It took awhile for me realize that It may be a month or so after it's out of your system to happen, but it will happen, and it will be harsh. I have taken this drug w/little conjunction of other drugs and know that it works to promote an overall sense of well being. BUT there are side effects [for me-everyone is different and thus cannot be expected to have the exact same experience]. For me I do have dry mouth, periodic insomnia, lower sex drive and constipation (the latter 2 were present before, just intensified by the drug). I feel like a Rx junkie, getting low on this drug causes me to panic. I have hoarded it for ins. changes. You win GSK- you now own me. I hope you're happy and proud of yourself. Despite choosing to be happy and not wanting to rely on a chemical to make that be, I no longer can. Perhaps I'm being too harsh on GSK and I truly have a chemical imbalance that will always need to be corrected??? Could be. I just think the warning should be known of how powerful Wellbutrin really is. Is it a miracle drug or the socially acceptable form of crack or smack? I have developed a love/hate relationship with it at this point in my life. I love to take it and fell good and I hate to take it and feel weak for needing it. Straight up depression just blows. Too indescribable to an outsider about how it actually feels.

column2: TA, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I have been taking this drug since July 2006.  I was experiencing a major depression episode and I had tried other drugs that made me fill hung over.  I noticed a difference within 2 weeks and complete turn around in my emotional state within 6 weeks to 2 mos.I lost weight, my sex drive returned in full force and my level of anxiety about going to sleep decreased.  I give this drug A+.

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: Before this medication I was absolutley a mess. I was crying almost everyday, on my days off from work I would lay on the couch and would not get up all day. I had stopped going out with friends, gained over 30 lbs, and overall just didn't care about anything. I decided it was time to take action and as much as I thought, oh this is a phase and I will snap out of it, I realized I couldn't do it on my own anymore. I started out at 150 mg and yes, there were side effects. I couldn't sleep at night, I lost my appettite (which I didn't mind), I was alot more anxious and kind of trembly, and I was sweating alot more and really thirsty. At first I was like, I can't do this, I work 12 hours a day I need sleep and food and, etc. These side effects lasted for about 2 months. For the sleeping issues I started taking this medication right when I woke up in the morning, about 5:30 am. I noticed that this helped me have more energy through the day and wore off toward the evenings but, still I was only sleeping like 4 hours a night. I started taking Xanax and Ambien, not together and not every night, but this helped alot. I have been on this medication for almost a year now, my doctor upped my dose to 300mg, I am soooo much more motivated, happy, and I have found me again.I have lost over 20 lbs and like I said this medicine gives me energy and the motivation to workout now and care about what I look like. The nervous, anxious, trembling feeling has gone away. I still sweat a little moe than usual and am thirsty but, it is not a major thing to me, I have adjusted. I would really recommend this mediaction to anyone who was having the symptoms of depression like I was. And, those symptoms weren't at certain times in the season or just every once in a while, yes they were worse during winter then summer. I was on a roller coaster of emotions up and down and I needed major help. Give this med. a try, ride out the side effects if you can, it is worth it in the end!!!!

column2: bipolarlady, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: When I started taking this med, I was sick as a dog and still depressed. Then two months after I started taking it and a bump from 150mg to 300mg. I woke up and I felt better. That dark feeling was gone. Without wellbutrin I would not be here today.I can say that and stand behind it. It also has an side affect that I love; weight loss

column2: May, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)

She fell and hit her face on a hard object and almost cut her eye out. Very dangerous medicine! Totally not worth it.

column9: I've taken an assortment of other antidepressants in the past and never had success with any of them like I have with Wellbutrin. I have no negative side effects. All other drugs I've taken have made me extremely lethargic and disconnected. I have none of that with Wellbutrin.
Brought out tics and intensified already present anxiety, no benefits for ADHD symptoms noted.

While I don't want to stop taking Wellbutrin, the insomnia is a real problem, and as of yet my doctor and I haven't found a way to overcome it.

It takes the rough edge off and I am much nicer to be around.  I do have to watch my weight though, seems to have put some pounds on.  That's minor to losing friends, a marriage and even the dog feared me.  Wellbutrin has saved my marriage for sure.

column2: baerRN, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I orrigonally went on Wellbutrin SR to quit smoking 2 1/2 years ago. It worked and I don't smoke anymore. Then I realized I like the new me and realized I had undiagnosed depresion. After 2 years of taking it I went to a new OB-GYN for my yearly and she inadvertantly changed me to Wellbutrin XL (it stays in your system twice as long as the SR). I didn't think anything of it as I am a RN and work in a pharmacy where the standard is the XL dose. After 3 1/2 to 4 months I started having blurry vision(I had LASIK 2 1/2 years ago), nausea, diarrhea, dizzyness, then anxiety, jittery, then shaky and rapid heart rate with missed beats. So bad that one day I clocked out and went to the ER. My heart was racing at 120-135 beats per minute. They sent me home on a Holter monitor to record my heart and it came back with frequent sinus tachycardia with occasional premature atrial and ventrical beats. Not realizing the drug switch, I was positive that my thyroid was out of wack. Had all the tests even changed doctors since I didn't think the first doc was doing enough. Finally I asked an eye doctor if Wellbutrin could be causing my vision problems and he told me to get it changed. I start a new medication in the morning, so we will see if it works for me.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)

I don't feel that I need it as much as I used to. I went about a month without it and I did pretty good. Now I've switched to the generic brand for insurance reasons and I will see how that goes.

I take Calcium Citrate + D twice daily.  In addition, 20 mg. of Crestor at night.  (My cholestrol is at 200.)  I take AcipHex, 20 mg., of the morning.  I take 15 mg. of Dalmane to sleep.  However, I do not take the Dalmane or Crestor with the night pills.As far as I can tell, the Welbutrin is working -- when I can keep it down.  I do think it is a combination of pills.  The Lithium is new since August ---- I had been on Depacote since 1999.  If you have any suggestions on which pills to take, and then the others to help the nausea, please feel free to advise. column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months
column9: After years of smoking and probably hundreds of attempts to quit, my doctor prescribed Wellbutrin.  In just 3 days I could tell that my addictive need for nicotine was much lower than it had ever been. After a week on the drug, I tried to quit smoking once again. For the first time, I was able to go a day, then 2, then 4, then a week, then a month without a cigarette!  I am so grateful for this drug.  I have not smoked in 7 1/2 years thanks to Wellbutrin.  I never thought I'd be able to say that!  It's wonderful.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I had PAINFUL leg cramps after taking this drug for only 1 week. You could literally SEE the muscles in my legs tighten and twist. I stopped taking it before any other significant side effects were noticed.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
still_a_chainsmoker, 13-18 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: My doc put me on this medication for my depression, in addition to the 200mg of Zoloft I was on, to help me stop smoking. I was smoking almost a pack a day, and my lungs started to get real bad.. Anyway. He put me on it and it did NOT work AT ALL. My depression got out of hand and I was hospitalized for a suicide attempt. Hooray if it works for you; because it deffinately didn't for me.

column2: Michelle123563, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: This is the first anti-depressant I have ever taken. It has worked very well. Not only do I feel much happier, I have more energy too. Plus I lost 20lbs. I don't think the Wellbutrin directly caused the weight loss, but I think it gave me more energy and more of a desire to do things, which caused the weight loss

column2: SereNole,  Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: This has been the only anti-depressant I've tried that didn't make me feel worse than I did before. Zoloft actually had me contemplating suicide and Effexor had me gaining so much weight I physically felt just as bad as I did mentally. I tried others too before finally trying this one. The biggest plus was that I've LOST weight, cravings were drastically reduced, and my libido wasn't compromised. That was truly wonderful!

column2: MDB9000, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: This worked very well for both depression and stop smoking. I have had no side effects from using it. It has really made a big difference in my life. I have found that if I take it at the same time everyday then it tends to work best for me.

lucylux, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have been on Wellbutrin for almost 3 weeks now and I have noticed an improvement in mood.  Tried Cymbalta before which did absolutely nothing.  In regards to side effects, I have noticed that I feel almost manic at times and have been much more talkative.  I am normally a very quiet, shy person.  Since going up to 300mg per day I have also been experiencing nausea and dizzyness.  For now though, I will continue on this medication to see if my depression continues to improve.

column2: Cajun Queen, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
45-54 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: This drug may have saved my life. If not the drug, then in combination with therapy it did. I was relunctant to stop taking it but was effectively weaned over a 90-day period.

column2: angelbaby, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: This was a winner for me. I've taken several other antidepressants with varying sucess. Wellbutrin works well, but has none of the unpleasant side effects, like emotional numbing or decreased libido. I've also managed to quit smoking as the nicotine simply doesn't affect me anymore.

column2: Dennis, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Did not seem to address my ADD symptoms.  Actually brought on a sense of anxiety, impending doom.  Also caused sweats, tension, jitteriness.

column2: Cadiac/Open Heart RN, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Caregiver)
column9: I took it for anxiety and to quit smoking.  After smoking for 18 years...I quit.  Yes, it did cause some nausea at first...however you must eat when taking this medication.  Take with meals.  Also, don't give up.  It also has a side effect which decreases hunger.  I lost weight after quitting smoking...about 10 lbs.  I was scared after quitting smoking I would gain.  I didn't I lost.  This medication is a wonder drug.  It is rough in the begining as your body adjust.  It's not fun but give it time the side effects will go away and it is effective overall.  I really support the use of this drug.  I am an RN and also think if this drug does not help with smoking cessation try Chantix.  I am an Open Heart Nurse and we have had great success with our patients on Chantix.

column2: johnny, 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I used this for depression and smoking cessation. I took the XL, 150mg for the first week and felt fine and then the dose was increased to 300mg a day. It helped me quit smoking and I've been smoke free for 6 months! However it sucked for my depression. When i was on 150mg i felt fine but once it increased to 300mg i felt tired and sluggish all the time. I tried it for 3 months and finally i had to be taken off it cause it was too strong. It is good if you want to quit smoking.

column2: 65-74 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: Wellbutrin works better than any other anti-depressent that I've tried, however the side effects are scary. I also take xanax. I stopped taking the xanax for about two weeks and had a seizure. This was the first time I had ever had one. I was taking 300mg once a day in the morning. I then stopped taking the wellbutrin, but struggled with the depression again. I am now on 150mg once a day. I feel better mentally, but sometimes I feel a little dizzy the morning if i drink the night before. it also makes me sweat like a pig. The results are soo good that i can live with the stuff that comes along.

column2: marti, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I am "somewhat" dissatisfied with this medication. I recently was prescribed wellbutrin due to anxiety and addiction to cigarettes. I took it for 3 weeks and yes quit smoking but had more anxiety than ever and more depression. I had many fits of out of control crying and anger. My boyfriend brought the medication I was on to my attention because he knew that i was a little on the emotional side but not possessed. I even had a week long outbreak of hives. Although I am only 90% sure this was the medications fault. I was so distracted at all the other stuff I was going through I did not crave cigarettes and as far as drinking was involved I got sick after two drinks so I am taking a vacation from alcohol as well. I still have hives on and off so hopefully in another 24 hours the medication should be completely out of my system and hopefully hive free. I will finally be able to breath peacefully and with out a cigarette in my hand.
